title: Emergency Heatstroke Treatment
brief: How to rapidly cool and treat heatstroke victims when body temperature exceeds 40.5Â°C (105Â°F).
steps: Cool victim as rapidly as possible by dipping in cool stream if available.
If no stream available, douse with urine, water, or apply cool wet compresses to neck, armpits, and crotch.
Wet the victim's head thoroughly for maximum heat loss through scalp.
Administer IV fluids and provide drinking fluids if conscious.
Fan the individual to increase cooling effect.
Be prepared for vomiting, diarrhea, struggling, shivering, and shouting during cooling.
Monitor for prolonged unconsciousness and potential cardiac arrest.
Be ready to perform CPR if needed.
Watch for rebound heatstroke within 48 hours.
warnings: Heatstroke is life-threatening emergency requiring immediate cooling
Signs include swollen red face, red eyes, no sweating, unconsciousness
Victim may go into severe shock during treatment
Rebound heatstroke can occur within 48 hours
